tn.text: Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
"7 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"forgive every thing which people still owe you"

tn.ref: This is the manner of the release
tn.text: "This is how to cancel the debts"
a person who lends money to other people

The words "neighbor" and "brother" share similar meanings and emphasize the close relationship that they have with their fellow Israelites. AT: "his fellow Israelite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: because Yahweh's cancellation of debts has been proclaimed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because Yahweh has required that you cancel debts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an idiom. AT: "you must not demand it back" or "you must not require repayment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The nominal adjective "poor" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "no poor people" or "no one who is poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to the land of Canaan.

tn.ref: he gives you as an inheritance to possess
tn.text: The land that Yahweh is giving to his people is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that Yahweh is giving them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: if only you diligently listen to the voice of Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" refers to what Yahweh himself says. AT: "if only you are careful to obey what Yahweh your God says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you will lend ... you will not borrow
tn.text: The word "money" is understood. You can make the full meaning of this statement clear. AT: "you will lend money ... you will not borrow money" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: to many nations ... over many nations
tn.text: Here "nations" represents the people. AT: "to the people of many nations ... over the people of many nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you
tn.text: Here "rule over" means to be financially superior. This means basically the same thing as the previous part of the sentence. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: If there is a poor man
tn.text: Here "man" means a person in general. AT: "If there is a poor person"
"one of your fellow Israelites"
Here "gates" represents the entire city or town. AT: "within any of your towns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: you must not harden your heart
tn.text: Being stubborn is spoken of as if the person hardened their heart. AT: "you must not be stubborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: nor shut your hand from your poor brother
tn.text: A person who refuses to provide for a poor person is spoken of as if he were shutting his hand so that the poor person cannot get anything from him. AT: "nor refuse to help your fellow Israelite who is poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: but you must surely open your hand to him
tn.text: A person who helps a poor person is spoken of as if he were opening his hand to him. AT: "but you must surely help him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: not to have a wicked thought in your heart, saying
tn.text: Here "heart" represents a person's mind. AT: "not to think a wicked thought" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The seventh year, the year of release, is near
tn.text: It is implied that because the year of release will happen soon, the person thinking this will be reluctant to help a poor person since it is likely that the poor person will not have to pay him back. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "seventh" is the ordinal number for seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"the year to cancel debts"
Something that will happen soon is spoken of as if it were physically near. AT: "will happen soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: so that you will not be stingy in regard to your poor brother and give him nothing
tn.text: "so that you are not stubborn and refuse to give anything to your fellow Israelite"
"shout to Yahweh for help"

tn.ref: it would be sin for you
tn.text: "Yahweh will consider what you have done to be sinful"

tn.ref: your heart must not be sorry
tn.text: Here "heart" represents the whole person. AT: "you should not regret it" or "you should be happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: in all that you put your hand to
tn.text: Here "put your hand to" represents the whole person and work that he has done. AT: "in all that you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: For the poor will never cease to exist in the land
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "For there will always be poor people in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
The nominal adjective "the poor" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "For poor people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: I command you and say, 'You must surely open your hand ... in your land.'
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "I command you to open your hand ... in your land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]]) (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: open your hand to your brother, to your needy, and to your poor
tn.text: A person who is willing to help someone else is spoken of as if his hand were open. AT: "help your fellow Israelite, those who are needy, and those who are poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: your brother, to your needy, and to your poor
tn.text: The words "needy" and "poor" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that these are people who cannot help themselves. AT: "help your fellow Israelites who cannot help themselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
Here "brother" means an Israelite in general, whether a male or female. AT: "If a fellow Israelite" or "If a fellow Hebrew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])

If a person could not repay their debts, they sometimes sold themselves into slavery to pay what they owed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "sell themselves to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"6 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"7th year." This "seventh" is the ordinal number for seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: you must not let him go empty-handed
tn.text: handed** - A person who has no possessions to provide for himself or his family is spoken of as if his hands were empty. AT: "you must not let him leave without having anything to provide for himself and his family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"generously give to him"

tn.ref: remember that you were a slave
tn.text: Here "you" includes their ancestors that were slaves for many years. AT: "remember that your people were once slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: that Yahweh your God redeemed you
tn.text: Yahweh rescuing the people of Israel from being slaves in Egypt is spoken of as if Yahweh paid money to redeem his people from slavery. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: if he says to you, 'I will not go away from you'
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "if he says to you that he will not go away from you" (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
Here "house" represents the person's family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: then you must take an awl and thrust it through his ear to a door
tn.text: "then you will place his head near a wooden door frame in your house, and then put the point of the awl through his earlobe into the wood"
a sharp, pointed tool used to make a hole (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
"until the end of his life" or "until he dies"

tn.ref: It must not seem difficult for you to let him go free from you
tn.text: This means that they are not resent it when they let someone go free. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Be pleased when you let him go free" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: given twice the value of a hired person
tn.text: This means the owner only had to pay have the amount for this slave to work than he would for a person he hired to do a job.
This is a person who works for pay.
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
to cut off wool or hair
"in the presence of Yahweh"
"each year" or "every year"
crippled or physically disabled
Here "gates" represents the city or town. AT: "within your community" or "inside your city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
A person who is not acceptable for God's purposes is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
A person who is acceptable for God's purposes is spoken of as if the person were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are wild animals with long thin legs that can run quickly. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:12:15|12:15]].

tn.ref: you must not eat its blood
tn.text: "you must not consume its blood." Yahweh did not allow Israelites to consume blood because the blood represented life. (See: [[:en:bible:notes:deu:12:23|12:23]])
